questionText: When this tower opened in 1889 it was the tallest building in the world.
This buiding was the tallest freestanding structure in the world from when it was completed in 1975 until 2009.
This is the tallest mountain in Japan.
The first person to go over this natural feature in a barrel was Annie Edson Taylor in 1901.
This is the current home of the British Crown Jewels.
This is the only one of the seven wonders of the ancient world that remains standing.
This highly photographed and filmed bridge is painted a colour called International Orange and is named after the strait it crosses.
This is where you would have gone to watch gladiator battles approximately 1900 years ago.
This is the highest mountain above sea level in the world.
This statue was France's gift to the American people on July 4, 1884.
What iconic performing arts venue, known for its distinctive sail-like design, was designed by Danish architect Jørn Utzon
What ancient temple, located on the Acropolis of Athens, was dedicated to the goddess Athena and is considered one of the most important surviving buildings of Classical Greece?
What renowned chapel is famous for its ceiling painted by Michelangelo and serves as the site of the papal conclave?
What prehistoric monument consists of a ring of standing stones and is believed to have been constructed around 3000 BC to 2000 BC?
This is the home of the Mona Lisa.
What volcanic archipelago in the Pacific Ocean is famous for its unique species of flora and fauna, which played a significant role in Charles Darwin's theory of evolution by natural selection?
What island in the Pacific Ocean is known for its nearly 1,000 monumental statues called moai, which are large stone figures carved out of volcanic rock thought to represent ancestors?
What is the highest mountain in Africa known for its three volcanic cones, Kibo, Mawenzi, and Shira?
What famous freestanding bell tower in Italy is known for its unintended tilt?
What famous palace was a principal royal residence from 1682 until the start of the French Revolution in 1789?
What large Canadian glacier-fed lake is known for its stunning turquoise waters and mountainous surroundings?
What iconic landmark, originally created as an advertisement for a real estate development, has become a symbol of the American film industry?
What historic site is known as the location where Guglielmo Marconi received the first transatlantic wireless signal?
What highly secretive and controversial military facility is often associated with UFO sightings and conspiracy theories about extraterrestrial life?
What large lake in East Africa is the source of the Nile River and the largest lake by area in Africa?
What famous geyser is known for its highly predictable eruptions, attracting tourists with its regular display of boiling water and steam?
What famous commercial and entertainment hub is known for its bright lights, electronic billboards, and as the site of the annual New Year's Eve ball drop?
What historic palace complex, once home to emperors and their households, is renowned for its extensive gardens, grand halls, and elaborate architecture?
